intro: Pedicularis alaschanica var. tibetica, commonly known as the Tibetan lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes hemiparasitic plants that derive some of their nutrients from host plants. The species is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers, which are often clustered in dense spikes. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Due to its unique ecological role and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in specialized botanical gardens.
